channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - Intl Homepage - News
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - Intl Homepage - News

item.title: Exiled oligarch: Russia will use hacking tactic again
item.description: A former Russian oil tycoon who became a prominent critic of Vladimir Putin has said he believes the Kremlin leader is savoring the widespread belief he influenced the US election, and warns that the Russian president will likely repeat the ruse of appearing to hack western democracies in the years ahead.

item.title: How long will Trump's Russian honeymoon last?
item.description: In the 25 years since the fall of the Soviet Union, the US-Russia relationship has waxed and waned.

item.title: Trump's win set for official vote
What's the Electoral College?
item.description: Are you wondering how the election actually works? Watch this video explainer to find out.

item.title: Can vote go against Trump?
item.description: Donald Trump is busy building his Cabinet and planning his agenda, but he isn't really, officially going to be President quite yet. One of the peculiarities of American democracy is that it's a group of 538 "electors" -- members of the Electoral College -- in this nation of 318 million who actually pick the president.

item.title: 5 mysteries about Trump's victory
item.description: When historians look back at the 2016 election, there will likely be many big mysteries to solve.

item.title: China says seized drone is part of US military strategy
item.description: China hasn't returned a US underwater drone that its navy seized in international waters in the South China Sea last week, the Pentagon said Sunday.

item.title: Obama: Dems lost by not showing up
item.description: President Barack Obama faulted his party's campaign strategy in an interview airing Monday, arguing Democrats suffered stinging electoral losses in last month's vote because they failed to campaign in hard-hit rural areas.

item.title: McCain issues ominous warning
65 buses carry evacuees to safety
item.description: Evacuations of Syrian civilians and rebels from eastern Aleppo have resumed, ahead of a UN Security Council vote on a draft resolution which would allow the UN to monitor the process.

item.title: Jordan shootout: Tourist, police killed
item.description: Four policemen and a Canadian woman were killed in an ongoing shootout in southern Jordan on Sunday, as unknown gunmen fired at security patrols and police stations, the Public Security Directorate said in a statement.

item.title: 'SNL' skewers Trump, Putin, Tillerson
item.description: After being criticized by the President-elect as "mean-spirited" and "not very good," Alec Baldwin and his impersonation of Donald Trump returned on "Saturday Night Live" this week.

item.title: Super Mario sends Nintendo stock south
Zsa Zsa Gabor dies at 99
item.description: Zsa Zsa Gabor, the Hungarian beauty whose many marriages, gossipy adventures and occasional legal scuffles kept her in tabloid headlines for decades, died Sunday, said her former longtime publicist Ed Lozzi. She was 99.

item.title: Deadly snake imitates tinsel on tree
item.description: An Australian woman made a shocking discovery Sunday when she spotted a deadly snake wrapped like tinsel around her Christmas tree.

item.title: New twist in Anne Frank mystery
item.description: Who betrayed Anne Frank?

item.title: 'Frozen woman' is actually...
item.description: The report to police was deadly serious -- an elderly woman apparently frozen to death inside a parked car in Hudson, New York.

item.title: 55-car pile-up on icy highway
item.description: A brutal blast of frigid air sweeping the United States created icy roads that caused multiple-car pileups and left at least six people dead in Virginia, Maryland and Oklahoma, authorities said.

item.title: Mosul: 'May God take revenge on ISIS'
Toddler killed in road rage shooting
item.description: A 3-year-old boy was shot and killed during an apparent road rage incident in Little Rock, Arkansas on Saturday when his grandmother took him shopping, police said.

item.title: Revenge of the forgotten
item.description: Never has there been a more humbling year for a reporter.

item.title: How cats affect health
item.description: When a stray cat wandered onto the tracks of a midtown 7 train last month, the MTA halted the entire subway line until the animal was out of harm's way. At the same time, the U.S. government euthanizes millions of stray cats each year.

item.title: This is the first time humans have caused anything like this
Aleppo girl Bana evacuated from war-ravaged city
item.description: A 7-year-old girl who captured the world's attention by sending tweets from Syria's war-ravaged city of Aleppo has been evacuated with her family, a medical charity said Monday.

item.title: Revealed: New photos of Russian T-50 stealth fighter
item.description: The world is getting a fresh look at Russia's newest stealth fighter jet after images were posted on the manufacturer's website.

item.title: From immigrant to elector: 'I am living the American dream'
item.description: Ash Khare came to America from India with two bachelor's degrees, $8 in his pocket and a dream -- the American dream.

item.title: 'Where it all began': Photographing Trump's return to Alabama
item.description: Before her trip to Mobile, Alabama, on Saturday, photographer Melissa Golden wondered whether she would experience a sort of dj vu once she arrived.

item.title: Malaysia: Myanmar crisis a 'regional concern'
item.description: Myanmar's treatment of its Muslim Rohingya minority threatens to undermine the region's security and stability, Malaysia's Foreign Minister said Monday at a rare international meeting to tackle the crisis.

item.title: Is this how you see the world?
item.description: For a decade, British photographer Jasper James has shot some of the world's most populated cities for his ongoing series, "City Silhouettes." Using double exposure, a technique that combines two images, James juxtaposes dense cityscapes with lone individuals.

item.title: Moscow's top secret Cold War relics
item.description: The Cold War: a time of border standoffs, spy-versus-spy intrigues and the bristling tensions of the Berlin Wall.

item.title: Drugs the Nazis were on
item.description: Historians have long known that Nazi soldiers took drugs -- but what exactly did these drugs do to their bodies and brains?

item.title: Federer, Sharapova, Serena: 2017 the year of tennis comebacks
item.description: If 2016 was a season of memorable firsts in tennis, call 2017 the year of the comeback. Roger Federer, Maria Sharapova, Serena Williams and Nick Kyrgios -- and there are more -- are among those returning to the circuit after being sidelined for differing reasons.

item.title: Vietnam's best beach resorts
item.description: From isolated retreats and eco-resorts to jam-packed party towns, Vietnam has a beach resort for everyone.

item.title: China throws down gauntlet to Obama, Trump
item.description: In seizing an unmanned, underwater US Navy drone in international waters off the Philippines on Thursday, China has thrown down a North Korean-style gauntlet to both the outgoing Obama Administration and the incoming Trump team.

item.title: What the West can learn from Duterte's war on drugs
item.description: It's so typical of the West to sneer at the actions of what they see as "small brown folk on the other side of the world."

item.title: With Russian meddling, truth is as disturbing as fiction
item.description: David Pepper: Four years ago, I decided to take a stab at writing my first book. I intended it to be fiction. I may have failed.

item.title: Russia must face US retribution
item.description: The way American news media and politicians have characterized the Russian "threat" has often been hysterical and overblown.

item.title: 'Rogue One': A diversity master class for Trump
No fees on International Payments
Fix your Exchange Rates today with
Buy and Sell in 33 currencies with
Raped 43,000 times, but fighting back
Saving children from life on the streets
item.description: Andy Stein shifts on the balls of his feet, leans against a wooden railing, and fidgets.

item.title: Canadian teenagers sold for sex
item.description: As Lauren Chopek painfully details her story, she does so with the reticence of a survivor, as if somehow remaining silent would have been better.

item.title: Child predator caught by tiny clue in photo
Girls drugged and sold as child brides
item.description: "When I woke up I didn't know that I was in China."

item.title: The '5 disguises' used by human traffickers
item.description: Across the U.S., there is a movement to prioritize human trafficking prevention in our nation's communities. Schools, youth service programs, juvenile corrections services, group homes, and other youth-oriented spaces have begun to recognize their great potential to empower youth to stay safe from exploitation.

item.title: Aleppo's emotional evacuations
item.description: Some civilians and rebels have escaped the war-torn city, but conflicting reports suggest evacuation efforts may not last.

item.title: Heartwarming moments of 2016
item.description: This year has had some lows, but there were also some inspiring moments. Here are some of the most heartwarming ones.
